page.title: 09FARM LIVESTOCK
page.content: {DAIRY COWS}THE FARM STUDIED KEPT A HERD OF 120 BRITISH FRIESIAN CATTLE. THESE SHARE 40 HA. OF GRASSLAND WITH A HERD OF SUCKLERS AND DAIRY REPLACEMENTS. THE COWS ARE HOUSED IN WINTER IN PURPOSE BUILT CUBICLES WITH ACCESS TO SILAGE FOR FEED. ADDITIONAL FEED IS PROVIDED AT MILKING TIME IN THE FORM OF CONCENTRATES. MILKING IS CARRIED OUT IN A HERRINGBONE PARLOUR WHICH HOLDS TEN COWS AND MILKS FIVE AT A TIME. THE COWS ARE MILKED FOR 305 DAYS AFTER CALVING AND YIELD ABOUT 9000 LITRES PER LACTATOIN. THE CATTLE ARE MILKED AND MANAGED BY ONE MAN. RELIEF MILKERS ARE PROVIDED AT HOLIDAY TIME. SOME CALVES ARE USED TO REPLACE OLDER COWS. THESE ARE THE PRODUCT OF ARTIFICIAL INSEMINATION.
